it.polimi.se2018.client.network.socket

Class SocketHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.client.network.socket.SocketHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientInterface, java.lang.Runnable

    public class SocketHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientInterface, java.lang.Runnable
    Class SocketHandler: represents the connection link between the client and the server, the socket handler is responsible to take the input the client provided to view and send it to the virtual socket (socket client implementation) across the network using the socket technology for the communication. It creates the socket connection to the server, send the event to server after the choose of the client and receives in a thread (infinite loop) the object sent by the virtual socket, let the view show the different output depending on the runtime event it receives.
    Author:
    fadda-miceli-mundo
    See Also:
    ClientInterface, Runnable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void readEvent(Event event)
      method that read the event passed as parameter and depending on the type of the event received let the view with the correct id use their generics and behavioural show methods to show output to the client
      void run()
      Override of the method run represent the Socket Handler Input mode, this is a thread that generate a loop waiting for new object input to read, then call the method responsible for the proper behaviour, catch IOException if something goes wrong.
      private void sendEvent(Event event)
      sendEvent represent the Socket Handler Output mode, it is used to send the event invoked by the client to the virtual socket across the network, catch IOException if something goes wrong
